Reviews.Title: “3rd world standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the type of hotel you expect to experience in Mozambique and not London!! The room quality was poor, bathrooms were inadequate and shared. The furniture was poor. The bedsheets and blankets were dirty. The only good thing was that it was cheap. For £10 more you could get something twice as good so i think its worth going elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “One word, appalling!”
Reviews.Author: tiggz07
Reviews.Content: When we arrived didn't look the way it did on the website it looked a dump. Filthy windows dirty netting didn't look clean from the outside so was worried what it looked like in the inside. I was right to be worried, it was disgusting filthy carpet dirty walls any notices was ripped and old terrible service would never ever go there again. We would catch less illness staying the night on the streets wouldn't send a homeless person there. The hotel has serious hygeine problems. I advise anyone to look else where spend abit more on a hotel even if its basic but at least it should be cleaner than this place.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKED LIKE A DRUG HOUSE!”
Reviews.Author: aands1605
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe the state of the place when we arrived. The front area was disgusting and run down. The hallway area was dirty the floor was dirty so were the walls. We ended up booking and staying somewhere else it was that bad. The website we booked through said own bathroom but it was shared facilities that were in a poor state, leaking taps dirty toilet shower and floors. The rooms were dingy and also dirty. We literally booked another hotel inside this place. I would not advise staying here. I wouldn't stay there as a last resort. It was that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Is what is says on the tin: Budget accommodation in Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Livelylass13
Reviews.Content: This is a Budget Guest House so don’t expect any frills. Location is fantastic - easy 7min walk from King's Cross station. Facilities are simple but totally adequate: TV; Kettle (with condiments); FREE Wi-Fi; Sink in room; Shared bathroom and toilet. Don’t be fooled by initial impressions. Dark lighting makes it look grubby, but when you look closer it is very clean with the whitest sheets I’ve ever seen. Staff were very accommodating, friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, personal and trusted service.”
Reviews.Author: Faye1988
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed with Budget Guest House in November this year. The amenities were basic but clean and warm, despite the freezing conditions outside. The value for money was great considering what situation I was put in unexpectedly. Being 8 months pregnant I suddenly went into labour and had to leave the hotel late at night leaving all of mine and my sisters belongings in our room. As I am from Lincoln, the next day, we had to travel all the way home in terrible weather conditions, but needed to gather all our belongings, which the staff did for us ready to pick up on our way home with newborn baby in tow. My sister managed to collect all our things but left behind a pair of boots. I called the hotel and they kindly agreed to send the boots but also offered to pay for them to be sent. I would definitely stay with them again and recommend their services.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay there!”
Reviews.Author: MiKaKiev
Reviews.Content: Rate is below zero. It's looks rather like a militant safe house. Everything is dirty and falling apart. Just a shameful shack. Expedia should be ashamed of having this hotel on it's site.

Reviews.Title: “a disgusting sham. total disgrace”
Reviews.Author: frantastic85
Reviews.Content: this 'guest house' is a total disaster. it is dicgusting. the rooms are filthy. my friend and i arrived only to be told our booking wasn't confirmed, despite having a reference number and having paid a deposit. we eventually got taken to our room, which wasquite obviously a room where ladies of the night take their punters. we got kicked out of this room by an employee of the guesthouse saying 'you are in the wrong room, the lady will kill me', at which point he took us down to what can only be described as a 'dungeon'. there are rolled up bits of carpet randomly lying around, presumably to dispose of the bodies in! all the beds were squeaky and in desperate need of replacing. the place has no bathroom to speak of, only a shower which i wouldn't wash my dog in. the fire exits are blocked up by dirty linen. the 'reception' is a bedroom! the whole place stinks. you would have to be crazy to stay in this place. health and safety wise it is a nightmare, the place should be shut down. you couldn't pay me to stay there. we ended up going to the travel lodge up the road at 11pm after deciding that we just couldn't stay there a minute longer. take my advice and dlo not go anywhere near the place. seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever been”
Reviews.Author: hughelena
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I ever been. The location is good, right in the heart of London, but it does not worth it. I would not recomend the place to anyone even if I hate that person. When we got into the building we were taken to the "reception" (this was a room where the employee lives). In the reception, on the floor, it was a piece of meat to defrost, dirty plate with a fork and knife with rests of food under the table, I could not believe that the place was a reception so I started to imagine how the room will look like. I think there was only one toilet to share in the entire building (not sure and not interesting), the shower was dirty so we decided we will only use it in as an emergency. Our room was downstairs, I think that blankets were never washed so we decided to sleep with our clothes on. It was a door inside the room to a kind of kitchen-laundry, not sure what that was, but there were dirty sheets and dirty plates. We did not see any rats but we suspect their existance.

HotelInfo.Name: Budget Guest House
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Swinton Street | Kings Cross, London WC1X 9NL, England
